{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe 13 participants were tasked with solving maths problems with the help of a chatbot, that was tuned to assist the users without solving the problems for them.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTo investigate the effects of explanations, participants were split into two separate groups, that provided different chatbots: Group (A) was using a chatbot, that provided an explanation for its outputs, group (B) did not receive an explanation.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QBoth groups were served tasks from the same pool and answered the same questionnaires after completing the tasks.\\E$"}

{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe selection was performed to ensure that the problems were solvable by \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q-students, taking into account the clarity and difficulty of the problems.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QParticipants were given sets of three random problems selected, with the constraint that only “medium” and “difficult” problems were included during the study.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTo save time during the study design, the problems were selected form an existing dataset.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe problems were presented digitally in a custom web application.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe participant were shown the task image, text, and answer options at once.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe design of the chatbot was driven by several requirements and constraints, derived from the research questions and practical considerations.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QDue to a lack of free API options that sufficed the research requirements, the chatbot was implemented locally using LM Studio \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q, which allowed to experiment with different models and configurations before the study.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe available models were filtered automatically to only include models that were runnable on a M4 MacBook Pro (12cpu, 24 GB RAM) according to the program.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe remaining two models were tested using identical 2 identical system prompts.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QAt the beginning of the experiment, the participants were given a short introduction to the study and the tools they would be using.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QDuring the study the participants were asked to solve three randomly selected tasks after one another.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QDuring the experiment qualitative and quantitative data was collected in several ways.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QQualitative data was primarily collected by conducting experiments using the think-aloud method \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QAdditionally, the conversation of users with a chatbot were recorded, to be combined with the transcripts of the think aloud protocols.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QA cover story was provided to the users for the experiment, telling them the goal of the study was the evaluation and comparison of the different chatbot versions \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe data was transcribed using OpenAI Whisper \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q using the “medium” sized model and specifying German as language.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QAfterwards the transcripts were validated against the original audio recordings and combined with the applicable chat histories to a single transcript per task.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QQuantitative data was gathered using a number of post-experiment questionnaires to gather data about user's acceptance, self-efficacy, and mental load during the tasks.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QAs the study was performed in German translations for the questions and responses were required.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTherefore, the questionnaires were manually translated.\\E$"}

{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QParticipants were selected from university students, colleagues, friends, and acquaintances.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe participants were split into two groups pseudo randomly in order of their registration, alternating between the two groups.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe following coding methods cycles were performed (using the terminology of \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q):\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QSecond Cycle Coding: Axial Coding: The codes from the first cycle were then grouped and organized using axial coding.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTheoretical Coding: Finally, theoretical coding was used to develop a theory or process model from the previously grouped codes.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QQuantitative data was collected and evaluated to complement the qualitative data.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe questionnaires were evaluated according to the instructions provided in the original publications.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe results were then compared between the two groups to identify any significant differences between the different chatbot versions.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe data analysis was divided into qualitative and quantitative analysis, which were performed separately and then combined during the interpretation of the results.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe qualitative data was analysed using a grounded-theory approach and focused on retaining the data-to-theory connection \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTo preserve this connection, the analysis was performed in two cycles following the example of \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q and general methodology for coding outlined by \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QIn accordance with the original publications the scores for TAM and CSE were calculated as the mean of the respective questionnaire items, where TAM was split into the two dimensions Perceived Usefulness and Perceived Ease of Use \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q-\\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q questionnaire was evaluated on four of the six subscales.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe subscales for Physical Load and Temporal Demand were excluded from the evaluation, since there was no significant physical effort required and no time limit set for the tasks.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QIn accordance with \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q the \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q constructs were evaluated using the “raw TLX” (sometimes called “RTLX”) to reduce the data collection and evaluation effort.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QTo determine if there were significant differences between the two groups, a Mann-Whitney U test was performed for each of the seven constructs.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe Mann-Whitney U test was chosen, as it does not assume normal distribution of the data and is suitable for small sample sizes.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe evaluation of the questionnaires was performed using Python with the libraries Pandas and SciPy.\\E$"}
